H0.text: what did the akkadian empire include. Babylon

H1.text: what did the akkadian empire include. Sumer

H2.text: what did the akkadian empire include. Elam

H3.text: what did the akkadian empire include. Assyria

A4.text: The Akkadian Empire succeeded the long-lived city-states of Sumer.

A5.text: The Akkadian Empire expanded into neighboring states such as Elam, Lullubi, Hatti, and Gutium.

A6.text: The Sumerians and Akkadians originated from different areas.

A7.text: The Akkadian Empire is thought to have included parts of the Levant, Hurrian and Elamite territory.

A8.text: The Weidner Chronicle (ABC 19:51) states that it was Sargon who 'built Babylon in front of Akkad'.
